action.action-desc: Mr. Carter of Louisiana (for himself and Mr. Thompson of Mississippi) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security
Additional sponsor: Mr. Higgins of Louisiana
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to make improvements to the Securing the Cities program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Securing the Cities Improvement Act.

section.header: STC program eligibility, metrics, and congressional oversight
section.text: Section 1928 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 596b) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking high-risk urban areas and inserting jurisdictions designated under subsection (c);
by amending paragraph (7) of subsection (b) to read as follows:
establish performance metrics and milestones for the STC program, monitor expenditures for the program, and track the performance against program metrics and milestones; and

in subsection (c)(1), by striking from among high-risk urban areas under section 2003 and inserting based on the capability and capacity of the jurisdiction relating to preparedness and response, as well as the relative threat to such jurisdiction, vulnerability of such jurisdiction, and consequences for such jurisdiction, regarding terrorist attacks and other high-consequence events utilizing nuclear or other radiological materials; and
by amending subsection (d) to read as follows:

subsection.text: Not later than two years after the date of the enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Homeland Security of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate a report regarding participation in the STC program, the establishment of metrics and milestones for the STC program, performance against such metrics and milestones, and plans for any changes to the STC program.
